one_reviews_text: No Cross-Buy for the Quest and also a really quickly boring nature simulation.

I was looking for something like this when I first got VR. I was happy to find it. I enjoy the different places you can explore and I had fun exploring the halloween fields during Halloween. I just wish I could save the scene when I add trees to the forest when I go back to it.

review_title: Very relaxing - if you let go
one_reviews_text:
To get that out of the way:
The graphics are mediocre, the animations are clumsy and its all very low poly for a PC title.
The sounds make up for the somewhat dated graphics, though.

That beeing said, if you manage to overcome those (sometimes immersive breaking) hurdles, you will be transported to a place where you can happily be on your own and in a very relaxing and calming mood.

I applaud the developer for building "gray storm" but there is something for everyone to sit back and enjoy. Its great to kick the rain in or switch to sunset atmosphere.


Nonetheless: 
when you've found your secret spot to sit down and relax, you will know why I gave it 5 Stars.

A very beautiful app but I was really struggling with the interface. I was trying to rotate around without moving my head but couldn't find any buttons that could do this (funny, I thought an earlier version could??). Also I was trying to activate the icons that were around and above me but just gave up after a while. Moving around was good with the main trigger button but I really wanted to move continously forward instead of just hopping from place to place and I remember the earlier version did that. I wouldn't be surprised if all that functionality was there but I was at a loss trying to find it. I think people unfamiliar with Virtual Reality would have a lot of trouble figuring out how to move around.
enter clipping and non-playable nature walks at your own risk.

Beautiful and relaxing.

Just 2 recos for the developers.

1. Make the movement adjustable with the trigger. It kinda breaks the experience when it has a fixed speed
2. The menu with the trees and the light and stuff expands all the way to my back. It would be more user friendly if everything was in front of me and dont have to turn back. If im sitting on a chair is kinda annoying.

I use this wonderful game to meditate and relax. Sometimes just think about everything and sometimes to think about nothing. Weather effects and control over them. Real time lighting. The ability to move within and interact with the locations.  Tranquil and peaceful.  Can't recommend this enough. VR isn't just for gaming.  I hope everyone enjoys this gem like I do.   6/5 stars imho.  Best Meditation and relaxing experience on any platform imho and at a very fair price!

I gave this 2 stars only because of the music. The graphics are terrible,movement of trees and animals are at best robotic,people giving this more than two stars haven't seen a good vr experience,I have a 9th gen cpu and 2080 gpu with 32gb of ram so it isn't my system,this isn't relaxing at all and the side to side movement is atrocious. Need a refund on this, it should be free after all this time, StormLand here I come! LOL
Best free world experience I have played. Great graphics, many world's,  peaceful. Priced fair. Thank you! Not a lot to it as a game, but that's what I expected.

I was looking for something that would just let me engoy being in vr. Something peaceful and pretty. Well I got that and more! I swear I feel like a god casualy wandering the universe on a whim and rearangeing it a bit here and there to suit my mood.

Overall a fantastic experience. There's one thing that really breaks the relaxation for me though and that's the lack of any type of slow movements. When you press the trigger to move forward, it's either a jolt forward or not moving at all. It despirately needs a way to let you half hold the trigger to slowly move at the relaxing pace you want to move in.

I was looking for something to pull the plug in the gray moments ... I would say that this application succeeds in full to the purpose. I really hope the developers keep improving it. As far as I'm concerned it's excellent, I was looking for something similar.

It is not very bad but I did not get relaxed. The sounds are to sharp/harsch(?) (I don't mean the volume ...hard to explaine. English is not my native language)
They hurt my ears. Also the graphics are ok. Wish it would be better.
Animals do move a bit awkward and the tree movement is weird.

Something I would absolutly love is an option to sit by the water and just splash it around or slowly make it move just the way real life how water moves.
Interaction with the animals. Now they just walk towards me and push me aside...not very pleasant.

I am keeping the game and hope the maker is going to read the negative feedbacks and improve the game.

This is in the good direction but please improve.

Beautiful scenes, love the animals, this is a truly excellent game/sim/experience. I actually didn't expect to get this much when I bought it, how great to be surprised by a game that over-delivers.
Some suggestions that you might want to consider if/when you add/update: 
1. Sometimes the POV seems too high up. I'm not sure the average person looks down on an elk ... Perhaps an option to lower/raise eye-level, unless you were going for the idea of the POV being super-tall. That's a minor thing anyway.
2. An option to control the volume (music and SFX) from within the game while playing. This I'd really appreciate.
3. The ability to import your own tunes would be nice.
4. As another reviewer mentioned, you could always add a few more scenes - we wouldn't complain :) 

Anyway, Thanks for such a great game!

I love this game! Not only is it quite beautiful, but I like being able to grow trees, flowers, change from day to night, etc. etc.  Lots to do here. But...one plea! PLEASE make some more scenes!! I've already played through the ones you have but am hungry for more. One thing I like is that the animals are sometimes a surprise. That is, not always in the same place, and sometimes different ones as well. I can see you put a lot of time and work into this and it remains one of my most favorite programs. Please make more!! Thanks for listening.

Honestly a great relaxing experience. It is a great tool for meditation and just relaxing. Plenty of scenes to choose from. Definetly worth the money.

A few things I wish were different.
-You should be able to enable smooth turning instead of snap turning. Also maybe be able to change movement from where your head is facing to where your controller is facing.

Perhaps a little more interactivity. 
-You can walk right through animals and they do not acknowldge you at all. 
 -Perhaps the ability to pick up rocks and other objects. 
-Maybe add the ability to play seated so you can just sit on the beach.  
-Be able to play your own relaxing music in-game? Or instead of simply being able to turn the in game music on/off, add a volume control
-Multiplayer with friends!

None of the environments had a relaxing effect on me, but with their low poly models, amateur animations and annoying sounds they were rather spooky or terrifying.

It's all ambitious and surely well meant. I like that the areas to explore are somewhat larger. The idea of being able to influence the environments in various ways is a good start. Changing the time of day and weather effects is interesting in theory. 

However the whole delivery is lacking important aspects of quality. It's fair to mention that there are several well made free steam VR environments out there, that are offering far more polished experiences. 

The number of places to go seems ok, but at a closer look they are all composed of the same models only with different lighting and colors, with a few exeptions.

The animation of branches and tree leafs, supposedly 'shaken by wind', just looks strange. Some mammal animations look hilariously silly. The ambience sounds are mixed without sensibility. Every sound loop screams at you at full power without much variation. It's like they just kept the very first rough draft of sounds and moved on. Teleportation makes sounds to be suddenly cut. Birds are screaming in your ear without pause when approaching certain trees. Mammals scream and roar in continuous short loops without mercy - never pausing! Some rare sounds seem to have a very low resolution and make you think your headphones are broken.
review_feedback:
Hello, it's always a terrible sinking feeling to get a 1 star review especially when you seem to like the concept. Nature Treks has had a a huge amount of time, effort and consideration spent on it over a 2 year period with many updates in that time. We always try to listen and improve where possible, sorry it didn't live up to your expectations.
The environments do all have different models, not entirely sure why they looked the same to you. The audio has been mixed and positioned with great care, its unfortunate you feel so critical about that aspect. 
There are allot of animals within the environments and much of the content reacts dynamically, so a users experience with the animals is never the same twice, its possible that you caught some of them on a bad day.
Hopefully you will give Nature Treks a few more tries and who knows, we might win you over.

one_reviews_text: This game is well worth the money, I mean its beautful it just sucks me in, its relaxing, its calming, it sucks you away from real world problems, also its got a lot of nostalgia for me. (Suggestions) As beautiful as this game is, I wish it was more interactive, like maybe rocks you can pick and and throw, maybe you can pet certain animals, and maybe give an option to where you can choose the music, but overall these 4 stars really show that this game is beautiful, if you happen to add what I suggested I will easily give it 5 stars, keep up the good work!

I showed it to my mom and she loved it! She always wanted a game where she could escape. This did it! It is very enjoyable and very relaxing. I definetly would reccomend this to anyone wanting to get away from everthing.

It's not often I write reviews but I've been playing this today in wait for the Quest version, what a beautiful experience it is.
Loads of large environments to choose from. Excellent choice of movement systems. Some lovely subtle features with great attention to detail. A really relaxing and magical experience. Everyone I show it to loves it playing it. A universal gem.

review_title: A good idea but still needs work
one_reviews_text: I love the idea but if the experience revolves around a beautiful environment , the graphics still need to be more believable for it to work. Some of the trees strangley "shake " more than blow in the wind, in some scenes the same daytime birds awkwardly sing at night, and the ocean water seems weird and unatural.  I really support this kind of idea and hope that they will continue to improve the graphics and overall experience. I'm not sure we need so many nature scenes to choose from. Maybe fewer scenes with improved graphics would be better?

Yes, it is a wee bit odd that birds chip in the midle of the night...and yes, some trees seem to shake more than they sway in the wind...

But you know what? I dont care, cause it is all so serene and it is all so beautiful. I just find my favorite spot and then just sit there taking it all in. Sometimes I might throw an orb which may yield both snow flakes as flowers and sometimes I just wait for flowers to spring into beauty before they dissipate again...

It's serene, its beautiful, its magical all at the same time...

I'm gonna say worth  the discounted offer price for sure...

It's a great quality VR experience but it has so much more potential.  

Works well on my i7 7490 & 1070Ti.   Purchased at discounted price of 4.99 GBP I'm pleased with my purchase providing future updates deal with a few qualms

The GUI is slickly designed and works very well as an introduction to the whole experience.  Looks like a massive amount of work has gone into the GUI and environments (currently 15) They are pleasing and offer a great VR demo.  And that's the nag... at its current state... demo is what I 'm thinking I would use it for. But I do see how people could loose themselves in the therapeutic peace and tranquility. 

Would have got 5 Stars if it actually saved the changes you make to the landscape and other environs.  When you exit the scene and go back later the whole environment is set back to default.  I'm not sure how invested I'm gonna be transforming the environments, then returning if it doesn't get saved.

Would be even better if the experience offered more interaction (and better creature animation in some areas).  Wandering around (for me) feels a bit aimless.  That said it's pretty and an interesting, innovative approach to VR

I'm banking on the dev continuing to work on it tho.  I really do like this. It has stacks of potential to offer so much more.

The graphics are good but they're better by using Super Sampling x1.30 (Via Oculus Tray Tool) An experience that relies upon the scenery needs great graphics.  It would also be good to have a settings option.

DEV: features I'd like to see...

* Environment changes made saveable
* More purpose to the Trek
* Better quality creature animation (in some areas)
* Ability to use own music (or other audio) files from local disk
* Ability to invite friends around your saved environments

Will be very happy to change my score to 5 as and when appropriate updates occur.  I feel sure they will

This game is awesome. The graphics are great, the music is great, and its a great way to enjoy your time. You can put trees, rocks, and flowers almost where ever you want, and either teleport or walk. The game runs nicely with an i5 8400 and GTX 1070. Overall its a great game. Definitely worth the $10!

review_title: for anyone who wants to get away
one_reviews_text: I absolutely love this "game".  It doesn't have any objectives in it, there's really no begininng or end and that's what makes this so unique and wonderful.  For people who would spend countless hours wandering around hyrule just to see the scenery, this is exactly what you need.  The landscaping and animals are fantastic, I love how free walking has been added to the monotonous teleportaion so common to new VR, but necessary in this experience.  I hope there will be more areas added or another release, just as moving.  Thank you!
Will give this a 5 out of 5 when you can control the volumne and add my own music. Listening to the same music with no way of playing any other ruins the experience

its a mix of a god game + absolutely gorgeous nature scenes and incredivle music..

great way to chill the fck out and just explore, create, and passively enjoy a really beautiful set of worlds...

I've wanted exactly this out of VR for so long but have been unable to find it... finally this game brings all the elements of chill and creation I've wanted

super satisfying... absolutely worth the $9.99.. one of the few games I can easily share with family

Fantastic VR experience. It has a good graphics and a wide variety of content at a very reasonable price. The only thing I would ding it on is that a few of the animal assets are a bit lame.  I hope that the developer comes out with additional worlds, even if they are paid DLC.

review_title: Could be awesome with a few tweaks
one_reviews_text:
Very cool, relaxing, interesting environments. Please please let us have smooth rotation? I promise I won't get sick and leave you a bad rating. The snap teleportation is very annoying. Also, variable speed movement would be good, with maybe a logarithmic range -- squeeze lightly to drift forwards; squeeze fully to "run."

Four stars because the movement is still not wonderful (though that's an easy fix), but I love the worlds. Definitely recommended.
review_feedback:
Hello, thanks for leaving a nice review. Variable speed movement is possible with the hand motion, tilt your hand up and your movement will be reduced.
Seems like you guessed the reason we use snap (instant) rotation of 45 degrees :) Smooth rotation can often give people nausea.
For cases like this perhaps it would be ideal to allow everyone to set their own speed for rotation. I've made a note of this for the future.

one_reviews_text: I've updated my review from a 2 stars to 4 because I took another look at this and was pleasantly surprised. You can now walk move, there's lots more environments (the quality of some of them feels better) and there are animals that create a more interesting experience. It's clear the developer(s) has spent a lot of time improving this experience, since I initially bought it. Well worth the money in my opinion. The sounds are fantastic. I remember buying an environment sound CD for more than the price of this visually impressive VR experience. The one thing I'd value in this would be to control the music volume and nature sounds separately so I would have the music very quiet and the nature loud.
review_feedback: Thanks for taking the time to revisit the experience and amend the review, we really do appreciate that, its rare. Glad all work on the updates is making a difference.

review_title: Potential to be a  VR masterpiece
one_reviews_text:
Nature Treks VR really deserves more credit and fame. Its a brilliant concept, expertly crafted with obvious care and attention to detail. Its been out for a while now and I feel could do with a graphical upgrade for some environments. I'd also find the UI a bit clunky and would prefer to navigate a menu with a pointer. 
 There is also room for a little more polish. This is essentially a one person project as far as I am aware and with that in mind its an incredible achievment. There are not many apps that do realistic natural worlds in VR and out of all I have played (which is most) this comes second graphically only to the blu. Whilst the blu is largely a scripted and static experience, nature treks vr is anything but, you can explore large environments freely using your choice of movement, animals wander about and its generally a serene and magical experience . Nature Treks VR is much less trite than guided meditation and in my book easily the best relaxation app available. Love to see a graphical upgrade, will look forward to the sequel. A worthy 5 stars!

The concept works and I think I will remember my Nature Treks VR experiences fondly for a long time to come. Its an app that would not work outside of VR and its all the more refreshing for that. There is room for improvement but I enjoyed my time in here, I still give it 5 as its great value for money with loads of content. Its an experience everyone can enjoy. One of the few VR apps that I can genuinely say I am excited to see what comes next.
I like reading the bible and I believe its real.Jesus saved my life and soul.This application is soothing and smooth and can be appreciated by anyone.It resembles God's creation and creatures.

Wow, now this was a surprise, a gentle way to relax in serene environments all in stunning 3D VR.  I had been looking at this game for a while as I like to chill and looked at the reviews so decided to buy and I don't have a single regret.
           There is a good choice of locations with each one offering something slightly different from walking through meadows, to sun drenched beaches  to ambient nights in the forrest complete with ambient sounds.  The controls are intuitive and am relieved to find I can actualy walk around rather than teleport which is a major must in this kind of environment.   there is some interactivity with the ability to generate foilage in the forrests etc, to stelar objects in space and fish in the ocean. There are also lots of things to discover like one scene has dinosaurs in a Jurrassic setting while another has wild animals roaming that you stumble upon. I also found a wrecked aircraft in the ocean that I could explore. Another scene has a camp fire and windmill with authentic sounds that add to the already lush atmosphere which is comprised background sounds to suit each environment complete with relaxing music which can also be turned off in an instant with the excellent control inputs using the touch controllers.  You can even add thunder and rain in some scenes and change day/eve times which alter not just the lighting but the atmosphere and backround sounds. Absolutely brilliant and it is obvious a lot of thought has gone into this and hope the developers keep updating and adding to what is for me the best purchase on the Oculus Rift as it is just so useful to me with endless replay value.
        I am now looking forward to any future expansions and will happily pay more for those as this is indeed a highly recommended purchase at a great price.
       If you like strolling and want to chill then this is the definite software for the Oculus Rift that really immerses you in each location with total freedom to roam.  5 STARS!!!

I am strict on vr programs. After I read reviews and decide to get it, about half I take back. This is one that I like. When I am done, I feel relaxed in about 20 minutes. I haven't tried any other relaxing programs, but this one does what it was made for. Like a walk on vacation in vr.

This is by far my favorite, good job people. Its beautiful and amazing! A couple of questions though? The music is a bit overpowering, how can I turn it down in volume and leave the nature sounds up. Also how do I get back to the main menue so I can choose a different experience? So far I have to keep quiting the program and restart it to go to a different land.
Thanks
review_feedback: It is not currently possible to independently change the music and nature sounds, you can toggle off the music. Some sliders with volume controls would be needed to control them independently and the isn't currently a graphical user interface to support this. We will make an effort to support something in a future update. Press the back button to return to the menu.

review_title: Just what I was looking for
one_reviews_text: Been wanting an app for some time that allowed me to simply sit (or stand) somewhere and enjoy the beautiful nature: this one delivers the goods! And I can even walk around if I want to. ;) It's just as if you are really there. Great graphics, absolutely aesome atmosphere, good sounds (I always turn the music off), nice additional options (in case you want to do something more than just sit), very responsive developer too: 5 stars!

This is one of the best, if not the best, relaxation / zen apps for VR. It has absolutely beautiful environments that you can add a little flavoring to. For example, one of the environments is an underwater ocean. You can add fish, rocks, or plants to your environment. Movement is via joystick (free movement) or teleportation. Game has good textures and runs smoothly. However, it has no collission detection and almost no interactions with the environment.

review_title: Very well done, but annoying flaw
one_reviews_text: There's a LOT to like about Nature Treks!  The choices of environments are nicely diverse and the ability to modify them is a unique touch.  The graphics and color palettes are also very nice.  What ruins the experience for me is that the sound mix is, to put it kindly, terrible! The music is way too loud and your only options is to either have it on or off. You can't turn it down to a more suitable level (at least I haven't found a way). Turning the volume down on the Rift turns everything down.  Considering how complex the rest of Nature Treks is, adding a separate volume control seems like an easy no brainer that would earn it an enthusiatic five stars.  Going further, the ability to play my own music would be even better!

review_title: Simply The Best, Thank you! NEW
one_reviews_text:
Just when I though the game couldn’t get any better it did. There’s nothing more refreshing than to be able to free roam all over a map smoothly. I’ve tried other nature based games, and found out right away I can’t sit in one place longer than several seconds. But ten or so minutes of virtual walks is all I need to relax and center.

The animals are the best part. They’ve come a long way since the first ones I saw, not only in graphics, but some will now come up and demand attention. How do you tell a tiger no when she plops down right in front of you?

The dinosaurs are one of the best new additions, but I love the game as a whole and having a developer who take our feedback graciously and tries to make everyone happy is amazing. We now have interactive objects and other goodies that make me extremely proud of all the love, care and hard work that has went into this experience.

This is my go-to app for fighting my depression and anxiety and there aren’t enough words to express how thankful I am for such an amazing experience.

I am updating my review. The disappointing performance (on a 1080) has been fixed. The dev looks like he is continuously updating and adding content-- seems like he really cares. I respect that. Also, the newer maps are top notch. One nitpick, I wish there was customizable graphic settings.
review_feedback: Thanks for taking the time to update your review. Adding a graphical UI for customising options such a graphics settings is on the to do list.

one_reviews_text: Nature Treks VR provides the best environments for relaxation and meditation. I strongly recommend it to anyone who wants to relieve stress, sleep better, and live a healthy life in perfect harmony.

this is a very amateur attempt, graphics 2/10, audio 1/10, animal animation 0/10. you are not immersed into any of the worlds you visit and what is with the glare and fog. i thought my rift had fogged up. no this is just aweful sorry refunding
review_feedback: Unfortunately its impossible to please everyone. I have tried to update, improve and support the project as much as possible, its been in development for 3 years. I have over 15 years professional experience working for some large AAA studios. I'm sorry it wasn't what you were expecting.

one_reviews_text: Wow!  The last update a week or so ago improved the graphics and animations quite a bit.  With lots of added environments and animals it release is a nice place to visit and relax now and then.  It's come a long way since it's release over a year ago.  I hope the devs continue to improve and add.

review_title: deserves a place in your library
one_reviews_text:
I bought but refunded this game last Summer. After hearing about the various updates I decided to try it again... and I'm glad that I did. 
Pros - the environments are lovely and the ambience wonderfully calm. 
Cons - some of the animations should be revisited (the blue whale and dolphins). 

Now that the amount of content is plentiful I hope that the developer adds a bit more polish here and there. One last (small) thing - would prefer the teleport to work with the thumbstick, like in Oculus Home

Crazy good! I work in vr with a desktop overlay and this is the place to work. I can't say enough good things about it. 5 start not enough. P.S I use this exclusively in mixed reality and it always works with no glitches. Keep up the fantastic work!

This is a beautiful piece of work, which luckily everyone can enjoy.  Don't let its' very reasonable price put you off, it is a well crafted, fully featured VR expereience which allows you to wander, create and control various aspects of every scene.

The scenery is amongst the best I've seen in VR, especailly the hillsides, rivers, trees, rocks etc.  You have blink teleport or free roam (joystick), You grab onto icons to turn on and off items in the scenes, some you can throw to add into the scene, making you a creator.  You can create, trees, rocks, creatures, bushes, flowers, butterflies, fish, so much to play with in each scene.

There are loads of different, stunning scenes to roam around in.  I some scenes you can control the weather and time of day. 

Not everything is perfect, the animations aren't the best (please keep working on the experience to make it better), ocassionally the music loop stops... I guess it depends how long you are in a scene.  These are not things which spoil the experience, but simply improvements which will just mak e it better.

I think this is a lovely piece of work very well exectuted.

Nature Treks was the first game i buyed last year on steam when i got my rift.
After 30 minutes i asked for a refund. It had alot of "mistakes" and things.
Now after reading about the several updates i decided to give it another try.
And WOW!
The dev really did a great job on this one.
It has become my magic place in my library.
The nature , the animals , the music .... i can really recommend it!
Its a low price for the magic you will encounter.

980ti without any problem with other games/experiencies. 
Needs optimization.

Update: One of the best relaxing experiences. Super sampling 2.0 and everything working without any problem. There are some new experiences.
Congrats to the dev

Realy great traveling software all that contents for a low price. "+" I like the central Hub, environments are lovely and great job on the ambiance and sound. I am happy to discover all environments. Thank you to continue to add new environement / animals and to improve texture/things here and there 
"-" I don't like colored flowers that appears and disappears it make the world a little bit unrealist and disturb my look. Concerning supersampling an option could be useful (for my part I forced to 1.5 in Oculus debug tools coupled with Async Spacewrap and it realy improve the antialiasing/quality images - GTX 1060).Thank you again
review_feedback: Thank you for the review and the supersampling tips. The colored flowers appear based on the audio frequency. You can disable them in 2 ways, either toggle off the music by pressing 'button Y' or if you prefer to keep the music you can just disable the flowers and other audio visualisation effects by pressing 'button B'.  You should see a flower icon momentarily appear to let you know they have been disabled. Press 'button X' at any time in an environment to bring up the help panel. Hope this helps.

one_reviews_text:
Really nice and dense environments. Easy to control with touch. 
I can't seem to find an options/settings menu though (Oculus). Did a google search and the only info I get is for the Vive. I wish there a way to apply supersampling and/or fiddle with the graphics. Looking forward to see where this type of VR-Experience is going.

I love the different themed environments, and the art and lighting is really nice. Good to unwind. I would like the maps to be a bit more detailed, so I could feel like I have more reason to explore. But, you do get quite a lot of different environment options, so it's still worth the price.

The possibility to adapt the virtual world with the touch controllers is fantastic. I would still be interested in the area of science fiction or e. g. a kind of "TRON"world is my dream.
Update: 15.Dez. 2017: Developer: Thank you for your answer. The Interaktivität is great to place Trees, Flowers, etc. but it would be great to save my so created World!
Update: 25.02.2018: Thank you very much for the Dinosaurier! Something feeling like to be in Jurassic Park/World. Looks Great!

review_title: I  love everything about Nature Treks VR
one_reviews_text: I really love everything about Nature Treks VR. It has become my go to when I want to experience VR for just getting away from it all. After just a few minutes of this immersive experience I feel happy and refreshed. The graphics are top notch. The developer clearly cares about the quality of the experience and people in general (you can tell by the frequent updates and improvements that have been made to it over time, and it was great from the start). That sentiment is really important because it comes through in the game. Not only with the increasing beauty and diversity of the environments (new ones and animals were added since I first bought it over a year ago), but also the layout, colors, sounds, options for locomotions and more. I makes a great demo to show anyone. In this day and age of so much violence in video games, it's nice to have a place to get away from it all. Not only the stresses of life but also to hop into VR and not get shot at or attacked by wolves. I know I was looking for something exactly like this for years and now I have found it in Nature Treks VR. Everything about this VR experience is wonderful, I highly recommend you buy it, it has a long lasting value and is worth even more than the price it is.

Really enjoyed this app when I first purchased it, but I now revisited it and I'm impressed by the improvements in performance! It kept stuttering on my GTX1060, which I assumed was normal, glad it was fixed.

I first bought this app back in April 2017 and I must admit that I wasn't very impressed with it back then. However, they have made a *LOT* of great improvements to it since then, they have added some new landscapes and many new features such as being able to "plant" trees and butterflies, and you are now able to move around the landscapes at will using your controllers. This is a great app for simple relaxation and (non-guided, no voice-over) meditation and I can now recommend it without hesitation if that is what you are looking for.

review_title: Best Non Violent Title So Far
one_reviews_text: This is a really great expereince. It runs smooth as silk on my system with a 1080TI card. As others have pointed out I would not hesitate to use this to demonstrate VR to other people. I really enjoy exploring and this permits that though in a somewhat limited area. The various animals, including birds and fish make it very interesting. As others have said it might be nice to actually be able to save changes you have made but I imagine there are serious memory limits for that. For the money this is a wonderful experience. Strongly encourage checking out the "Creation" experience.

review_title: A lot of love in this creation
one_reviews_text: This is the future of VR. Already you can see what is possible, the creator has made such beautiful environments within the limits of current GPU generation, I can only hope I'll live long enough to see something similar done but with the details and texture of the Witcher 3 world i.e. For now, I'll find my peace in on of the stunning and relaxing nature settings of this game. Running smoothly, no stutters, locomotion is well implemented. Interacting with the environment makes is last longer, but I guess the main goal of this game was to let you relax in beautiful scenery, kind of like an after work spa and meditation therapy session :) Well worth every penny.
this is grate thanks

Nature Treks VR is a fantastic simulation to explore and relax. It has a large selection of environments to choose from and each one is unique in atmosphere.
The scenery feels alive with animals roaming around and the ambience is very immersive.
Nature Treks VR is also a perfect experience for first time VR and my go to app to show everyone interested in the technology and doesn't want to shoot anything.

A great idea done well!

Massive amount of dropped frames on a 1070. Dev says its fixed but dont believe him beacuse it isnt. and restarting the enviroment doesn fix it. I actually refunded and brought it again because he said it was fixed but alas..
review_feedback: Hi Benji, It was an issue with the supersampling rate getting carried over to the next scene. That has been fixed and I've had a number of people confirm that it was a fix for them and the performance data I have through Oculus confirms that. Honestly I'm not sure what is causing your issue. If you wanted to hop onto the steam forums and give me some more details of your setup I will be happy to look into it for you, otherwise just drop me an email. Since launch the game has received several free updates including interaction via the creator orbs, multiple locomotion options, 5 new environments and reviews on steam at 91%. I continue to do my very best to support and improve the experience with free updates. I'm not a Dev that lies to customers

one_reviews_text: I have two 1080 cards working together that is able to produce games in 4k (3840 x 2600 something) just fine. All my VR games worked fine besides this :( I feel so sad that I  cant use it properly. I've read that others have had the same experience and it's been a while but still no fix. Please help me what to do with this so it will be usable. I makes me feel sick due to the shaking.
review_feedback: UPDATE: I found the issue affecting some users and it is now fixed! I am so sorry, I could not reproduce it and had no idea the extent some uses were experiencing stuttering.

one_reviews_text: This is everything I wanted VR to be.

review_title: A Great Idea, But Terrible Performance
one_reviews_text: The game is a stuttery mess. Some areas are better than others, but its still bad. I can run pretty much anything else at max settings. I don't know why this is so juttery. Bad optimization, I guess.
review_feedback: UPDATE: I found the issue affecting some users and it is now fixed. I am sorry, I could not reproduce it and had no idea the extent some uses were experiencing stuttering.

one_reviews_text:
What a gem this is. There is allot of content that will appeal to all types, ages and genders, making it a superb app to introduce anyone to VR. I've seen my nephew and grandma both gasp when playing it and they are 80 years apart in age.

Pros: The locomotion is very polished, there are a variety of ways you can move around the world making it a pleasure to explore. The creator orbs work brilliantly and add a whole new dimension to the experience, I encourage you to experience with them all, there are some memorable surprises. It looks great and there is a huge variety of large, quality environments to experience and discover. There are loads of animals to find. The variety of experiences available is perhaps its biggest strength. Want meditation app, you have it. Want an underwater experience, yes you can have that. Want a pure nature simulator, you guessed it. Since the update you can even create your own solar system. All these elements blend together and it works beautifully.

The Average: Some of the animal animations are amazingly life like but some could do with some more attention to reach that standard consistently. Some of the grass seems a bit flat when I get close.

The Bad: I didn't to write anything bad about Nature Treks VR because its given myself, friends and family such a lot, but for an app this polished, I think the UI (or lack of it) expects to much of the user. You might initially find yourself spending a few minutes working out if you can throw or grab something.

What I'd like to see: Some more work on some of the animal animations. I'd love to see even more details in the environments and some smaller creature on the trees and leafs.

To conclude, I found this to be a very touching and encouraging experience. A wonderful app that just keeps improving and evolving. I've played every relaxing VR experience and I can say with some confidence this is the best, by a considerable margin.
Bad graphics, framerates, laggy half-assed controls with absolutely no descriptions, and it's got me twisting my head around to see anything
review_feedback: Hi, sorry you had such a poor experience. I'm not sure exactly what caused your experience to be so bad, allot of the issues you mention are avoidable. Nature Treks averages at over 90% on steam so its certainly not a "half-assed" effort. Snap turning is implemented using the left stick. The controls should be simple, left trigger to use free movement and right trigger to blink teleport. There is a help menu that should be easy to bring up (it says "press x for help" when you start the app).

one_reviews_text:
You should say on the description that you corrected the supersampling problem ! I had bought the game but didn't want to comment until it was fixed.

Now it works and it's so nice. This is the kind of thing I wanted VR to begin with.

A couple of points though : 

-I float above the ground and it's a noticeable when I sit to enjoy the place ; I don't think it's my sensors but you never know.

-The trees in the forest have sharp, cubic trunks, is that normal ? I didn't have that impression with trees in the other sims, is that because there are so many ?

In any case, it's very atmospheric and I don't regret buying it at all, i'm glad to say (the framerate issue scared me when I first tried it, but I was right to wait).
review_feedback:
Hi Pyloric, thanks waiting and giving me change to fix some stuff.
The player position is about a 40 cm off the ground, allot of people prefer the sense of floating. So if your about 40cm off the ground its intentional, if its higher then it could be your sensor setup.  If I do change it to match the floor then I will need to lower the height of the foliage. The trees in Orange sunset have had their trunks optimised, yes unfortunately this is due to the quantity of them being rendered. There of plenty of graphical improvements that are planned, however these will need to wait until minimum spec increases.

one_reviews_text: The concept is a good one, and the environments are very well crafted. However, the framerate is simply unusable on a GTX 1060. The experience is the slowest I've seen in any VR app, so whilst it looks very pretty, jutters when you turn your head are the absolute norm.
so sorry, bad this was not so good. The enviroments are okay, the interactive manipulation is good. But the bad soundquality kill everything. if you are audiophil, wait for a sound update.
This is still my favorite VR program. The new bamboo scene is amazing. Thank you so much!

Downloaded Steam Check
Download Revive Installer Check
Purchased Game Check

DOESN'T WORK.  The game will not let you select an enviroment. SSUUUPPPER pissed. 
Spent about an hour trying to fix it.  Don't do this to your self. Skip this one.
review_feedback: I'm sorry you expected it to run with a windows mixed reality headset, its not intended to. If you do get the chance to play Nature Treks VR on a Rift or Vive please give it a go and hopefully you can see it in a more favorable light.

one_reviews_text: I'm new to VR and I was thinking of returning my headset recently. This was the first experience that I actually wanted to stay in for a long time and make me really forget that I was in VR. Keep up the good work and keep making experiences like this.

When i launch the game, the environnment and feeling seems top notch!
But the optimization is catastrophic!! it ruins everything!Minimum Requirement
 are totally false! (i run Lone Echo Without any problem).
i've got a 1070 GTX and it's like the Supersampling in the game was at 2 without possibility to change it!
No immersion possible when the FPS drops when you turn the head or try to grab an object.
For god sake give us the option to change graphic settings!.
Quite a shame because apart from that it seems a marvelous experience!
Developper please change and put options for graphics settings.
For the moment unless you've got a High End PC from the Nasa^^ stay away from this program.



Update by using the tray Tool forcing ASW to 45 and putting SS to zero the game is playable now but please optimize it avoiding us to use external tool...
review_feedback: UPDATE: I found the issue affecting some users and it is now fixed! I am so sorry, I could not reproduce it and had no idea the extent some uses were experiencing stuttering.

one_reviews_text: This is the kind of apps I'd like to play with, just viewing pleasure, immediately transport me to tranquility.
Eventually wrestled the headset back from my Mom and Dad. Beautiful worlds with something for everyone. If you want a go to app to demo VR, this is it.

Its not often I write positive review but I think the effort here deserves one.
Beautiful, varied landscapes and nice comfortable locomotion. Few niggles but not enough to drop a star considering the more than reasonable price tag. Great effort.
You this is pretty cool, just going around, planting stuff. Not very action driven but if I've ever just wanted to chill with VR, this and the medidtation app are top two on my list.
review_feedback: Thanks wizkid83. New content is in the pipeline.

one_reviews_text:
Seriously? What is with this teleporting crap? I spent $10 so I can stand? I want to explore!

I've tried to be fair by purchasing interesting VR games and experiences. No more. I'll be pirating everything from now on until this type of shovelware is eliminated. Unbelieveable.



          RESPONSE TO DEVELOPER: Great. The developer responded so I decided to update my review. Their response disappeared and it reset the "Helpful" number to 0. It was 18. Anyways, maybe it's because I'm using an Xbox 360 controller but I can't move around. Why this isn't/wasn't possible from the beginning is silly. Ocean Rift allows me to move around in the environment with what I have. Why can't I with this program?
review_feedback:
EDIT: Free movement has now been added for non touch users. Use the bottom left trigger to move and the left thumbstick to rotate. Hope this makes the experience better for you.
Hello, The description does say that the duel layered locomotion system is for touch users. Nature Treks VR still supports the Xbox One controller through static teleport points, this still gives you more freedom than other relaxation experiences. Nature Treks VR reviews at 91% on steam so its unfortunate that you don't seem to like the experience due to the limited locomotion support for Xbox controllers , if locomotion is an important criteria for you in VR experiences I would highly recommend investing in some touch controllers. A new underwater environment will be added in the next couple of weeks, hopefully you will enjoy that experience and overlook the limit locomotion when using the controller.

one_reviews_text: Enchanting and immersive experience for the whole family. Happily stay there a long time.

review_title: Small room access to a big world.
one_reviews_text:
If you have a small space and want to escape to a large world, this is it. While the graphics are not top end (would tax the video card too much if it did), they are still good.
Two cons I have is: 1) The envirorments has a fog like appearance, obsures vision in the distance. This works well in the distance, but within ~200ft it takes away from the details. 2) In some envirorments, looking up to the sky causes a yellow pallor over everything.
Pros: 1) Good controls, with 2 ways to move. 2) Some envirorments let you control time of day, weather, etc (These are nice). 3) There is a lot of variety of plants and animals if you look for it.

Recommendations: I do like this, and I think it is fair for the price. Not a game but more of an experience if you want to get away.

Wish List: I would love a coral reef with tons of sea life; even if only 30ft circle (To sit and look around). Would want deep vibrant colours to go with this.

EDIT: I clarified some of my comments, added a 3rd Pro and increased the rating by 1 - This is due to more time spent in the envirorments and noticing the details that went into the program.
review_feedback:
Thanks for the review. Nature Treks VR is open world, this means the detail in the environments needs to be consistent throughout, I cant use 'tricks' that other games use for objects that the player never gets close too. This means it can be very demanding on graphics resources, adding in extra detail unfortunately kills performance. Maybe when minimum specs change this can be addressed.
Added you request for a coral reef to the list.

review_title: Make me feel like a god!
one_reviews_text:
This is an excellent example of why VR is different from standard games.
Runs fine on my 1060 by the way.
Great support and updates.

This is a big improvement from my first review. No longer disappointed!  Glad to see support for Oculus Touch.  And glad to see more scenes.  It looks sharper, and looks like there is less haze.  Much Better!
review_feedback: Thanks for taking the time to revise your review, not many people bother to do that, its appreciated. Will be working hard to ensure the project continues to improve.

one_reviews_text: What a fantastic application to totally escape and chill out. Genuinely very impressed and more than satisfied with this experience. I look forward to using it on a regular basis. Thank you!!!
review_feedback: Thank you so much for this review.

one_reviews_text: I wrote to the developers about some suggestions and they were able to update the game with some changes. I would like to see more updates! So far, I really like it! It helps me wind down after a hectic day, I can be transported to a very relaxing and scenic place. I love the creators update, I like to play around with the tools available. Music choice is perfect! Would be better if there was an easier method for day/night and weather toggle. Also would be great to have more toys to play with such as glowsticks and fireworks! And also the ability to play your own music from your music library! Last update with the teleporting feature caused some issues, but hope they fix it!
review_feedback: Day/Night and weather toggles will be changing so you do not need to continually hold the orb. Its the most requested change at the moment and will be sorted soon. There are about 30 music tracks in Nature Treks, I am going to try and make it so you can cycle through them. Seeing as elements within Nature Treks VR change dynamically to the audio frequencies I think it will be a good addition. I will look into the possibility of users selecting from their own audio collection but it will depend on the complexity of work and how this will get integrated into the UI. Not aware of any issues with the teleportation currently, if you are still experiencing these can you please contact me with details and I will get on it right away. Thanks very much for the positive review.

one_reviews_text: Very peaceful and enjoyable. Well made in my opinion, hopefuly new environments will be added at a future time. Maybe the Moon or Mars?
review_feedback:
A space themed environment is on the list of environments to be added. 
Thanks very much for the positive review by the way. Its been a bumpy road on the Oculus store at times so its really appreciated and makes all the hard work worth it.

review_title: Better than others in same genre
one_reviews_text: Pretty environments. The creative content controls are cool. Would like for the weather and lighting effects to be persistent. Would like to see objects in the game like binoculars, in game camera and photos, Local music files access and any way to interact with the animals. And last but not least, I'm still looking for a nature VR game that will let me skip a stone across water! Is this impossible to implement?
review_feedback: Hello, the toggle for the weather, time of day changes will be changing to be persistent so you will not need to hold the creator orbs at all times. Animal behaviour has been improved already and is one thing which will be updated as an important part of the Nature Treks experience. It is possible to skip a stone across the water by the way, its an interesting problem and will need to be done with physics, will have a think about that. Thanks for the review.

review_title: Would be better without all the crap.
one_reviews_text: I bought this thinking: "Nature Trek, a trek through nature."  Then I played it, and it was more of a stand in some places in nature, while listening to music instead of ambient nature sounds, while someone tries to guide you through "meditation."  You can't trek at all, you can only jump from point to point.  This should be renamed 'Meditation in Nature,' so that people will know if this game is for them or not.
review_feedback: Hi Prewitt, Nature Treks does allow for that 'pure' nature experience. You can turn the music off leaving a full chorus of nature sounds in the environments. You have complete freedom to explore the locations if your using Oculus touch. The meditation element is the lotus enclosure accessible with the creator orbs, its an option and can be toggled on/off. Nature Treks VR has had several big updates recently, perhaps you have not tried it recently? If not please give it another go and I hope you have a better experience.

one_reviews_text: A few really pretty levels mashed against one of the most abstract control schemes I've seen. It takes 10 frustrating minutes to understand and another 10 minutes to go through all of the content. Hoping for a Touch update to make this one actually usable, as at the moment it is fully lost in this mess of frustration. update Dev response says locomotion is coming so will rereview after this.
review_feedback: Locomotion is available now by the way. Sorry you felt the UI to be frustrating, if you contact me with some specific feedback I can look into it. Shame your experience wasn't wholly positive but thanks for the review all the same.

one_reviews_text: Cliched yoga music and bland environments. Low quality graphics and terrible animation doesn't add to any immersion. Certainly not worth $10.
review_feedback:
Hi Shufflemoomin,
Nature Treks VR has had several big updates recently,I do urge you to revisit the experience now in the hope you get something more positive out of the experience.. In the new environment (Red Savanna) you will find elephants, lions, rhinos, hippos and more. Also the bird behaviour has been completely changed and they now form flocks and swoop down to the ground or to branches/rocks etc.

one_reviews_text: Beautiful environments, would love to move freely without teleporting, must have snap turning though, turning in VR makes me very nauseas.
review_feedback:
Hi all those things are now available in the most recent version.
-John

one_reviews_text: It is what is look like, relaxing and precious landscapes with smooth music.
review_feedback: Thanks z3ta, I hope your enjoying the recent updates, environments and animals added. More to come soon.

one_reviews_text: This is perfect for meditation.  For a good experience grab a stop-watch, set for 5 minutes, open app, go to location, turn off in game music, stream your favorite music, and breath deeply the whole time while taking in the awesome view.  Switch to another spot in the same location 3 more times for a total of 20 minutes a day.  At some point you WILL experience a sense of presence.  Limit yourself to 2 locations a week and you will enjoy this for at least a month.  The environments are realistically wonderful and believable along with a convincing touch of wildlife.  Well worth the money.
review_feedback: Thanks Very much for the amazing review lightworker. I hope the updates are adding to the experience for you. All the best - John

one_reviews_text: Although the experience is ok, the set places to sit seem to always point in just the one direction, add manual movement would help. Also theres a huge reflection bug in the water, noticeably more in turquiose. I hope the Devs update this with the user in mind, rather than set views, Oh and those water ripples are way too fast, its meant to be a relaxing experience isnt it?
review_feedback:
Hi Richhard,
Those issues with the water are now fixed. You can now freely explore the environments. Nature Treks VR has come ALONG way since you left this review so if you uninstalled it I would recommend giving it another try. - John

one_reviews_text: A generous 3, quite pretty, but poor scaling on textures, low poly environments and poor controls make this way over priced.
review_feedback: Hello Plagued, sorry your experience was not so good. There have been several big updates for Nature Treks VR since you posted this. If you are interested in the concept please give it another go, I really think and hope you will be pleasantly surprised. Thanks for the review all the same.

It is what is look like, relaxing and precious landscapes with smooth music.
